channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: France, U.K., others plan to recognize a Palestinian state. What does that change?
item.description: The recent push by several countries to recognize a state of Palestine is largely symbolic, but it carries diplomatic and potentially legal weight.

item.title: Songs of Love writes personalized music for kids — but can AI carry the tune?
item.description: For nearly 30 years, the nonprofit Songs of Love Foundation has created custom songs for kids with terminal illnesses. Now it has harnessed AI to expa...

item.title: An FDA panel spread misinformation about SSRI use in pregnancy, alarming doctors
item.description: A panel organized by the FDA cast doubts on the safety of antidepressants during pregnancy — drawing ire from doctors who say SSRIs are a crucial trea...

item.title: Alaska ignored budget crisis signs. Now, it doesn't have money to fix schools.
item.description: Alaska has long ignored warning signs of a budget crisis. Now, it has no money to fix something that is posing serious health and safety risks to stud...

item.title: What is the U.S. destroying $9.7 million worth of? Find out in the quiz
item.description: This week was full of mysteries. If you're a super sleuth who followed the news, you'll be well on your way to a perfect score.

item.title: Flooded streets and subway systems as storms slam US East Coast
item.description: New York and New Jersey have issued a state of emergency for areas hit by the strong storm system.

item.title: Person to Person: Norah O'Donnell interviews Brené Brown
item.description: "Person to Person" with Norah O'Donnell brings viewers the most intimate type of interview — going beyond the headlines through thoughtful conversatio...

item.title: Watch: 'UFO' spotted in Australian skies identified as Chinese rocket
item.description: Astrophysicists said that the unusual lights spotted over Brisbane were tied to a satellite launch from China.

item.title: Shock, chaos and a hollow win: What it's like to do a tariff deal with Trump
item.description: It's been a fraught process for many countries - with little detail about what exactly has been agreed.

item.title: "48 Hours" Presents: Love and Death in Alaska [Part 2]

item.title: At least 28 killed in Kyiv as wave of Russian strikes defies Trump ceasefire demand
item.description: Three children, aged three, six, and 17, were among those killed in the attack, Ukrainian officials say.

item.title: 7/31: The Daily Report
item.description: Jo Ling Kent reports on the upcoming deadline for sweeping tariffs, and what new data tells us about ICE arrests under President Trump so far.

item.title: Trump unveils higher tariffs on dozens of countries
item.description: The Trump administration is poised to hit dozens of nations around the world with higher tariffs starting next week.

item.title: Rural Texas county’s top leaders were asleep, out of town during initial hours of flood crisis
Judge blocks Trump administration from ending protections for 60,000 from Central America and Nepal
